title: 'Hero' police officer saves man after he fell into river
text:
A police officer has been praised after saving a man's life after he fell into the River Trent.
PC James Patterson entered the water with a life ring tied with a rope and grabbed hold of the man while three other officers worked together to pull them to safety.
The man fell into the water at around 4.30pm on Saturday 18th February and was taken to hospital for treatment.
There are some things you train for thinking you will never get to put into action, to get that opportunity and to save a life as a result has given me one of those rare moments where you actually look in the mirror and think 'well done you'.
– PC Patterson The four officers have been recommended for an award for their courageous and professional actions in fast-moving circumstances.
This was an exemplary piece of work by all officers. They all upheld the finest traditions of the British Police Service and have my wholehearted admiration.
PC Patterson displayed true courage, selfless commitment and determination as he entered the river to save the man’s life.
– Sergeant Julian Smedley, Nottinghamshire Police nottinghamshire Nottingham
